message:
Hey guys, I have a problem, I upgraded from ubuntu 14.04 to 16.04, and my splash screen got into an infinite loop of splashing between it and VCE error message. After some searching around, I found out that it is a problem of fglrx and radeon drivers as ubuntu decided to ditch them, so I blacklisted them through recovery, but I am still getting the same error and now my laptop is inaccessible (as when the screen keeps splashing, I cant even boot into terminal using ctrl+alt+f1)
Error message: radeon :VCE init error (-110)

data.message: Try disabling the radeon GPU from BIOS (assuming your radeon is switchable graphics capable) and remove all fglrx related packages after running chroot using a LiveCD
Get into run level 0 from grub and you got root
Sounds like when I would do a complete new install
If you have live CD try to install grub fixer
Hosam Shafik idea is better than mine

It's not grub guys 
The assholes in canonical do some dumb shit in the upgrades every lts. 
It's drivers issue and Systemd all over again. 
Some one was coding drunk as usual

It is the drivers problem as negm said, I just installed a fresh copy of 14.04 again, till I figure out what is happening with 16.04 
For reference: http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2016/03/ubuntu-drops-amd-catalyst-fglrx-driver-16-04
It seems 16.04 has a lot of issues. I used to get random blank white/black screen
I'm running 16.04 now with an NVidia card and everything is fine, no upgrade, just clean install
